result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Rose Schoen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:56 AM Defendant Kelly Rose Schoen in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Defendant indicates needs time to get counsel, requests 30 days.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:15 PM   Defendant Kelly Rose Schoen appeared by video.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for Atty Shannon Viel.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Atty Hodoawany makes oral motion on behalf of Atty Viel to withdraw from the case as defendant is now employed and no longer qualifies for SPD representation.  Atty Hodowany requests a status in 60 days to allow defendant time to retain private counsel.  State would like a hearing in 30 days, wants to keep this case moving.  Court grants Atty Hodowany's motion for Atty Viel to withdraw from the case, sets status.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:20 am.
No contact direct or indirect with Marine Travelift.

10:11 AM  Defendant Kelly Rose Schoen in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Kelly Rose Schoen.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.   Atty Viel to set prelim date with JA Parks after court today.
